item.title: Linux guy working in a Windows desktop
item.author: aleriospresidente@gmail.com (Alejandro Rios)
item.description: After >7 years of working on my own Linux machine, I now have to work on a Windows XP laptop for my new employer. It’s been almost a week and a half now, and I think I’m starting to get used to it (as far as a Gnome user can be), thanks to the following tools, that I had to install in order to survive and not getting mad: Firefox: for obvious reasons, the first thing is to get rid of IE.
